channel.title: C on Utkarsh M
channel.description: Recent content in C on Utkarsh M

item.title: Performance Schema vs eBPF-based Query Profiling
item.description:
During my time at IRIS NITK, I had the opportunity to work with a talented group of peers exploring distributed strategies for MariaDB. While I couldn’t dive deeply into every aspect, I gained valuable exposure, particularly to eBPF, which several colleagues were using for research and internal tools. That sparked my interest in the technology.

After completing my internship, I began building an eBPF based monitoring tool to understand the space better. Although the initial version was completed, I didn’t revisit it for over a year.

item.title: Building a Smart Network Interface Card on FPGA – Major Project Edition
item.description:
Project GitHub Link

In this post, I’ll walk through how we built a Smart NIC on an FPGA as part of our final-year major project. This project was developed with my teammates Chinmay and Muthukumar. The concept stemmed from our prior exposure to XDP/eBPF, which led us to explore hardware offloading. While our initial goals were ambitious, the timeline and complexity forced us to adapt along the way.

Project Objectives

Originally, the project aimed to:
